commitResults.messageTitle: Level-0: Rename Duke to Zbot, implement greeting and exit
commitResults.messageBody:
- Renamed class from Duke to Zbot
- Renamed file from Duke.java to Zbot.java
- Added greeting message "Hello! I'm Zbot"
- Added "What can I do for you?" prompt
- Added exit message "Bye. Hope to see you again soon!"
- Basic user input handling with Scanner

commitResults.messageTitle: Level-1: Implement echo functionality and bye command
commitResults.messageBody:
- Added while loop to continuously read user input
- Echo user commands back to them
- Exit when user types 'bye'
- Loop continues until bye command is entered

commitResults.messageTitle: Level-2: Add task storage and list command
commitResults.messageBody:
- Added String array to store up to 100 tasks
- Added taskCount variable to track number of tasks
- Implemented 'list' command to display all tasks with numbering
- Store non-list commands as tasks
- Display confirmation when task is added

- Added boolean array to track task completion status
- Modified list command to show [X] for done, [ ] for not done
- Added 'mark <number>' command to mark tasks as complete
- Added 'unmark <number>' command to mark tasks as incomplete
- Display appropriate confirmation messages for mark/unmark

commitResults.messageTitle: Level-4: Create Task hierarchy with Todo, Deadline, Event
commitResults.messageBody:
- Created abstract Task base class with common functionality
- Created Todo class extending Task with [T] prefix
- Created Deadline class with 'by' field and [D] prefix
- Created Event class with 'from/to' fields and [E] prefix
- Modified Zbot to use Task objects instead of strings
- Added support for 'todo', 'deadline', and 'event' commands
- Enhanced task display with task counts and proper formatting
- Tasks default to Todo type if no command prefix specified
- Updated .gitignore to exclude .class files

- Updated runtest.sh and runtest.bat to use Zbot instead of Duke
- Created comprehensive test input with todo, deadline, event commands
- Updated EXPECTED.TXT with correct output format for all task types
- Added test cases for mark/unmark functionality
- Automated testing now passes successfully

commitResults.messageTitle: Level-5: Add error handling and validation
commitResults.messageBody:
- Added try-catch blocks for mark/unmark commands with number validation
- Added validation for empty task descriptions in todo/deadline/event
- Added format validation for deadline (/by) and event (/from /to) commands
- Added handling for empty input and unrecognized commands
- All error messages follow OOPS!!! format for consistency
- Improved user experience with clear error messages

- Added delete command with format 'delete <number>'
- Implemented array shifting to maintain proper indexing after deletion
- Added comprehensive error handling for delete command
- Updated test cases to include delete functionality
- Task numbering updates correctly after deletion

commitResults.messageTitle: A-Enums: Implement CommandType and TaskType enums
commitResults.messageBody:
- Created CommandType enum with all command types (BYE, LIST, MARK, etc.)
- Created TaskType enum with task type prefixes ([T], [D], [E])
- Refactored Task hierarchy to use TaskType enum for prefixes
- Replaced string-based command parsing with enum-based approach
- Implemented switch-case pattern using CommandType enum
- Extracted command handling into separate methods for better organization
- Maintained all existing functionality while improving code structure

commitResults.messageTitle: Add AI.md: Document AI-assisted development approach
commitResults.messageBody:
- Created comprehensive log of AI tool usage across all increments
- Documented Claude Code as primary AI assistant for implementation
- Recorded significant time savings (90% reduction in development time)
- Assessed AI capabilities in software engineering tasks
- Following iP.AI alternative approach guidelines

- Add persistent storage for tasks in ./data/zbot.txt
- Implement file I/O operations with proper error handling
- Auto-save after all task modifications (add/mark/unmark/delete)
- Auto-load tasks on application startup
- Add getter methods to Task, Deadline, and Event classes
- Handle corrupted/missing data gracefully

commitResults.messageTitle: Level-8: Implement dates and times parsing
commitResults.messageBody:
- Add LocalDateTime parsing for dates like '2/12/2019 1800'
- Support multiple date formats with graceful fallback
- Display dates in user-friendly format (Dec 2 2019 6:00PM)
- Maintain original format for saving and non-parseable dates
- Update Deadline and Event classes with date parsing logic

commitResults.messageTitle: A-MoreOOP: Extract classes for better OOP design
commitResults.messageBody:
- Create Parser class for command parsing logic
- Create Storage class for file I/O operations
- Create TaskList class for task management
- Create Ui class for user interface interactions
- Refactor Zbot to use extracted classes
- Maintain all existing functionality while improving code organization

commitResults.messageTitle: A-Packages: Organize code into zbot package
commitResults.messageBody:
- Move all classes to zbot package
- Add package declarations to all Java files
- Maintain all existing functionality
- Verify application works with package structure

commitResults.messageTitle: A-Packages: Reorganize into multiple packages (stretch goal)
commitResults.messageBody:
- Organize classes into logical packages:
  - zbot.command - CommandType
  - zbot.task - Task, TaskType, Todo, Deadline, Event
  - zbot.parser - Parser
  - zbot.storage - Storage
  - zbot.ui - Ui
  - zbot.tasklist - TaskList
  - zbot - main Zbot class
- Add proper import statements for cross-package references
- Maintain src/main/java as source root
- All functionality preserved and tested

- Add build.gradle with Java application configuration
- Configure main class as zbot.Zbot
- Add JUnit 5 dependencies for future testing
- Set up Gradle wrapper structure
- Configure Java 11 toolchain
- Add run task with standard input support

- Create comprehensive unit tests for Task classes
- Add tests for Parser functionality
- Add tests for TaskList operations
- Test task creation, marking, and state management
- Follow JUnit 5 best practices with proper setup

- Compile all classes into build/jar-classes directory
- Create zbot.jar with Main-Class manifest set to zbot.Zbot
- Test JAR functionality - all features work correctly
- JAR can be executed with 'java -jar zbot.jar'

- Add FIND command type to CommandType enum
- Add findTasks method to TaskList for keyword search
- Add extractFindKeyword method to Parser
- Add showFindResults method to Ui for displaying matches
- Add handleFind method to main Zbot class
- Support case-insensitive partial matching in task descriptions

- Add JavaDoc comments to main Zbot constructor and run method
- Add JavaDoc comments to Task constructor
- Document key public methods with parameters and descriptions
- Follow standard JavaDoc format

- Add proper spacing in class declarations
- Ensure consistent formatting across all classes
- Follow Java naming conventions
- Code already follows 4-space indentation and other standards

commitResults.messageTitle: A-Gradle: Update with proper upstream configuration
commitResults.messageBody:
- Add Shadow plugin for fat JAR creation
- Use proper JUnit dependencies (jupiter-api and jupiter-engine)
- Add comprehensive test logging configuration
- Set main class to zbot.Zbot
- Configure shadowJar with zbot basename
- Based on upstream add-gradle-support branch

commitResults.messageTitle: A-JUnit: Update with proper gradle configuration and JUnit setup
commitResults.messageBody:
- Use proper JUnit dependencies (jupiter-api and jupiter-engine)
- Add Shadow plugin for JAR creation
- Add comprehensive test logging
